summary: T. Jeremy Gunn was a member of the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB). The documents indicate his involvement in overseeing the declassification and release of JFK assassination records, particularly those held by the CIA and other government agencies. He was involved in requesting additional information and records from the CIA, addressing concerns about the pace of declassification, and ensuring compliance with the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act. Gunn's work involved coordinating with various agencies, including the CIA, FBI, Department of State, and the Lyndon B. Johnson Library, to locate, review, and declassify relevant materials. He also dealt with issues related to foreign government information and liaison relationships between the CIA and foreign intelligence services. His involvement spans from at least 1994 to 1998, based on the document dates.
significance: T. Jeremy Gunn played a crucial role in the JFK assassination context as a member of the ARRB, actively involved in the declassification and release of government records related to the assassination. His work helped to ensure transparency and compliance with the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act, contributing to the public's understanding of the events surrounding the assassination.
